intro: Peristylus balaenolabium, commonly known as the whale-lip peristylus, is a flowering plant native to the Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Peristylus balaenolabium thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
